terms.termAndDeftn: information intended to help educators deploy effective strategies to assess learning

an indication that resource content may have: (1) factual (e.g. not just scientific) errors, (2) conflicts with generally accepted scientific thought, (3) a self-promoting emphasis or (4) a political, social or religious agenda
information about the effectiveness of a resource with a specific audience
a remark, explanation, advice, opinion, attitude, fact, proposed change, question or additional resource information
a summary of evaluative information (qualitative or quantitative) that may describe the strengths, weaknesses, pedagogical effectiveness, best uses for or general characteristics of a resource
an indication that the resource meets, supports or aligns with an educational standard, that is, a level of achievement determined by a professional group to which learners are expected to aspire too
a description or link to another resource that illustrates the resource content in a demonstrative way
information intended to help educators anticipate, detect and overcome common student misconceptions
a formal or informal evaluation of a resource
information intended to help educators foster a student skill needed for optimal resource use
information for using or modifying the resource within teaching or learning environments

dos.practice: If multiple annotations need to be associated with a resource, make multiple annotation metadata records.
When providing a rating, use the annotation type of Review.
